summary: This is a superseding indictment filed in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors, including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, enticement, transportation of a minor, and perjury. The document details her alleged role in grooming and facilitating the abuse of at least three minor victims by Jeffrey Epstein between 1994 and 1997, and her subsequent false statements under oath in 2016.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with multiple counts related to conspiring with and facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls, including grooming victims and arranging travel. Also charged with perjury for false statements made in a 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary abuser of minor girls, with Maxwell assisting in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating access to victims. His sexual abuse of multiple victims is detailed.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the superseding indictment as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Alleged co-conspirators in a scheme to entice and transport minors for illegal sexual activity. Maxwell had a personal and professional relationship with Epstein, was paid by him, and facilitated his access to victims.
Maxwell is alleged to have groomed and facilitated Epstein's sexual abuse of minor victims, and in some instances participated in the abuse.

events.title: Period of Alleged Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to and did entice, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor victims at various locations.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused by Epstein at his New York residence.

events.title: Massage of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell provided an unsolicited, topless massage to Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico residence as part of grooming her for abuse.

events.title: Maxwell's First Deposition (Perjury Count 5)
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell gave false testimony, denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls and claiming limited awareness of interacting with minors.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Deposition (Perjury Count 6)
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell gave false testimony regarding her awareness of sex toys at Epstein's home, Epstein's other sexual partners, and whether she had ever given anyone a massage.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the legal proceedings)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice and transport minors across state and international lines for the purpose of sexual abuse from at least 1994 to 1997.
The indictment details the grooming methods used, including befriending victims, discussing sexual topics, undressing in front of them, and giving or encouraging massages that led to sexual abuse.
At least three specific minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, and -3) are described, with Victim-1 being approximately 14 years old when the abuse began.
Maxwell is charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016 depositions, where she denied knowledge of Epstein's activities and her own involvement.
The alleged abuse and grooming occurred at multiple properties owned by Epstein in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as at Maxwell's residence in London.
